definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
cup/trophy cup/classifier for certain containers of liquids: glass, cup

sentences.english: He's taken to boozing and women lately.
You could if you wanted to, but it won't be based on God-orientation.
sentences.chinese: 你能否在酒桌上控制自己不要“貪杯”？

sentences.english: Her father was too fond of the cup and would lap the gutter at times.
sentences.chinese: 她父親太貪杯了，有時喝得醉醺醺的。

sentences.english: The wife condemned her husband for drinking too much.
sentences.chinese: 妻子因丈夫貪杯而責怪他。

sentences.english: A constituency there trusts only sober officials.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的選民只信任不貪杯的官員。

sentences.english: In the past, there is a woman, her husband likes wine excessive drinking.
sentences.chinese: 從前，有一個女人，她丈夫喜歡好酒貪杯。

sentences.english: Just a glass, no more than that.
He ran into debt as a result of drinking too much.
sentences.chinese: 他由於貪杯而負債累累。

definition: extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to forget one's manners/to forget oneself/to lose self-control (in a situation)
voice change (at puberty)/to alter one's voice (deliberately)/to sound different (when angry etc)
to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
